abstractContent.text: This paper presents the first treebank of Mbyá Guaraní, a Tupí-Guaraní language spoken in Ar-gentina, Brazil and Paraguay.
The Mbyá treebank is part of Universal Dependencies, a project that aims to create a set of guidelines for the consistent grammatical annotation of typologically different languages.
We describe the composition of the treebank, and non-trivial choices that were made in the adaptation of Universal Dependencies guidelines to the annotation of Mbyá.
